cause.description:
Mental Health America is the country's leading nonprofit addressing the full spectrum of mental and substance use conditions, working to inform, advocate, and enable access to quality behavioral health services. We have an established record of effective national and grassroots actions that promote mental health, and address mental and substance use issues with compassionate and concrete solutions. With our more than 320 affiliates, we represent a potent voice for healthy communities throughout the nation.
Mission: Mental Health America is dedicated to promoting mental health, preventing mental disorders and achieving victory over mental and substance use conditions through advocacy, education, research and service.
1. Mental Health America is celebrating 100 years of advocacy, public education, and support for Americans with mental health conditions.
2. Our programs educate the public, encourage reform, and promote the use of effective local and regional prevention and recovery programs.
3. Mental Health America’s Advocacy Network is a powerful voice for change that is made up of thousands of individuals nationwide.
4. It is essential that all aspects of mental health systems be reflective of the diversity of the communities that they serve.
5. Finally, we know there is no health without mental health.
cause.mission: 100 years | Celebrating the Legacy | Forging the Future
